poem:
Title: "In Early Light"

Chill wind stings, hands numbed in search of winter's gift. 
Unseen glimmer in the undergrowth, pulls at my young heart. 
Fungus, humble sovereign of the quiet wood. 
Not rot, but life reborn under frost's watchful gaze. 
A moment shared, mother and child, our whispers clothed in foggy breath. 
In the labyrinth of bark and leaf, we find our communion.
